entry.title: Re: ICMR Adjustment Workflow (WS78500087) тАУ No Fiori Noti...
entry.content:
Hi @XS1M 

When an ICMR posting adjustment workflow is created, the approver should be able to receive the notification in the Fiori Launchpad. I am not sure if you are asking if the creator himself should receive it as well. If so, you need also to include the creator in the team with role "Check Variance Adjustment Posting" in Manage Teams and Responsibilities - ICMR app. See Workflow for Intercompany Variance Adjustments help documentation.

Regards,

grace

entry.title: Re: How do I make DOX learn?
entry.content:
Hi, let me try to answer some of your questions:

Assumption: Based on your questions, it seems you are only trying the Template model in a Premium version, as you can see the Auto schemas.

1) Manual vs Auto:

Yes, a manual schema is only for the Template model, and the Auto can be a multi-model scenario depending on how you use it. On a premium instance, if you choose Auto schema, we include the Template model automatically. So, you don't really need to create a manual schema, unless you are just want to use the Template model.

Now, you can try following combination:

Auto schema + Default Extractors:

This prioritizes a pre-trained model to deliver the best results. However, if you provide feedback (correcting and confirming a document), it will switch to LLM-based extraction. If you still find the information incorrect and provide feedback again, a template will be automatically generated for you. Even after this, if you still see that the extraction is wrong, then it is likely that we have reached a limitation of the product, and it cannot be further improved. In this case, we study the issue on a case-by-case basis to determine if we can improve the extraction through backend training.

Auto Schema without Default Extractors:

In this case, we do not use any pre-trained model but use the LLM and Template model to deliver the results depending on if you provide feedback or not, as described above.

Lastly, regarding different layouts of documents: no, you can add more layouts in one Template; one Template is supposed to have only one layout of documents. The more documents you can add to provide more fields, but the layout should remain the same.

I hope it helps. thanks

Thank you for your help.

entry.title: ICMS rate defined by the origin and destination of the transport
entry.content:
Hi Everyone!

I need to create a rule that the ICMS tax rate in the purchase order is defined by the state where the transportation begins and ends, not by the supplier's origin and destination (plant).

Has anyone experienced this scenario? I considered creating z fields to identify the start and end of the transportation, but there's the issue of determining the tax rates.

Thanks Indeed.

entry.title: How to find out Integration scenario under the Integration & exception monitoring
entry.content:
Hi SAP,

 

We've connected several on-premise systems to the SAP Cloud ALM and configured several monitor use cases to explore the options.

 

Following the information ( Business Services Configuration) for integration & exception monitoring as part of the  Integration & Exception Monitoring - Setup & Configuration  the configuration/creation for Scenario is presented. 
Since this 'scenario' option isn't available in the config part (see printscreen) i used note DIGITS - There is no "Scenario Configuration" for possible resolution. This note also refers to the Business Services Configuration configuration without any info to create a scenario. Business Services Configuration, in my opinion is related to business service managment (BSM) ?!  so please assist in creating of viewing scenarios within the integration & exception monitoring. 
currently i have the cross topic global admin authorization and additional added the Integration Architect which should be needed due to the global admin, wright?

 

Please assist on this topic

 

Best regards,


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to find out Integration scenario under the Integr...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

 

Thanks for contacting SAP.

As what is recorded under KBA 3218867 - There is no "Scenario Configuration" section when Create Scenario for Integration & Exception Monitoring 

Integration Scenarios have been renamed to Business Services. There is no Integration Scenarios any more.

I do see you have "Business Services" under "Configuration".

A business service is a group of services and systems that represent a business scenario.

Please refer to the help page for more details regarding Business Services such as how to create or configure it.

 

Kindly feel free to let me know when further inquiries.

 

Best Regards,

Sunny

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA тАУ Pro-tips for demonstrating SAP Fiori тАУ Organizing your My Home page
entry.content:
Hi @Jocelyn_Dart . I hope you will notice my message.

Will you be able to share your thoughts?

The number of tiles showing up in the "My Home" page is inconsistent between different browsers.  I think what the user has done here is create her custom sections and added apps.  We have tried to replicate this using my own ID and changes to "My Home" in Google Chrome reflects in MS Edge and vice versa after refreshing the browser. What are we missing here? Is there any reset button in the "My Home" page?

Workaround(s) done: Basic clear cache (not working), hard refresh (CTRL+F5) (not working), update browsers to latest version (not working), incognito/private (working)

The catch is our user does not like to use incognito/private browser in her day to day activities. Please advise and thank you.

"My Home" MS Edge FLP look~

"My Home" Google Chrome FLP look~
